title: MARKET REPORT: Mining stocks dumped as factory activity in China shrinks
text:
MARKET REPORT: Mining stocks dumped as factory activity in China shrinks MARKET REPORT: Mining stocks dumped as factory activity in China shrinks MINING stocks were dumped yesterday after factory activity in top metals consumer China shrank at its fastest in two years in July. PUBLISHED: 23:15, Mon, Aug 3, 2015 | UPDATED: 08:24, Tue, Aug 4, 2015 GETTY Mining activity in China shrank its fastest in two years 
Anglo American and BHP Billiton weakened 32¼p to 779p and 45½p to 1137p, while Glencore and Rio Tinto fell 7¾p to 200¼p and 54p to 2432½p. 
Aero-engine maker Rolls-Royce flew 47p higher to 841p on turnaround hopes following the acquisition of a 5.4 per cent stake in the company by US activist investor ValueAct. Anglo American and BHP Billiton weakened 32¼p to 779p and 45½p to 1137p 
A sharp fall in oil prices lifted budget airline easyJet 24p to 1668p and British Airways owner IAG 17p to 551p, while bid takeover hopes boosted RSA Insurance 9p to 523p. 
Consumer products giant Reckitt Benckiser added 61p to 6210p as broker Kepler Cheuvreux told clients to buy with a 6800p target, while rival Unilever firmed 33p to 2940p. 
Product testing firm Intertek Group jumped 274p to 2721p after healthy half-year figures, while investors switched on to broadband provider TalkTalk, up 6¼p to 307¾p, as Berenberg closed its negative call on the company. Related articles
